window.c

00001

00009 it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
00010 the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or
00011 (at your option) any later version.
00012

00019 along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software
00020 Foundation, Inc., 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA  02111-1307  USA

00034 
00035 #include <window.h>
00036 
00037 /* shamelessly stolen from Bill Schottstaedt's clm.c */
00038 
00039 /* made worse in the process, but enough for our purposes here */
00040 
00041 //static REAL
00042 //sqr(REAL x) { return (x * x); }
00043 
00044 /* mostly taken from
00045  *    Fredric J. Harris, "On the Use of Windows for Harmonic Analysis with the
00046  *    Discrete Fourier Transform," Proceedings of the IEEE, Vol. 66, No. 1,
00047  *    January 1978.
00048  *    Albert H. Nuttall, "Some Windows with Very Good Sidelobe Behaviour", 
00049  *    IEEE Transactions of Acoustics, Speech, and Signal Processing, Vol. ASSP-29,
00050  *    No. 1, February 1981, pp 84-91
00051  *
00052  * JOS had slightly different numbers for the Blackman-Harris windows.
00053  */
00054 
00055 REAL *makewindow( Windowtype type, int size, REAL * window )
00056 {
00057     int i,
00058         j,
00059         midn,
00060         midp1,
00061         midm1;
00062     REAL freq,
00063          rate,
00064          sr1,
00065          angle,
00066          expn,
00067          expsum,
00068          cx,
00069          two_pi;
00070 
00071     midn = size >> 1;
00072     midp1 = ( size + 1 ) / 2;
00073     midm1 = ( size - 1 ) / 2;
00074     two_pi = ( REAL ) ( 8.0 * atan( 1.0 ) );
00075     freq = two_pi / ( REAL ) size;
00076     rate = ( REAL ) ( 1.0 / ( REAL ) midn );
00077     angle = 0.0;
00078     expn = ( REAL ) ( log( 2.0 ) / ( REAL ) midn + 1.0 );
00079     expsum = 1.0;
00080 
00081     switch ( type )
00082     {
00083     case RECTANGULAR_WINDOW:
00084         for ( i = 0; i < size; i++ )
00085             window[i] = 1.0;
00086         break;
00087     case HANNING_WINDOW:       /* Hann would be more accurate */
00088         for ( i = 0, j = size - 1, angle = 0.0; i <= midn;
00089               i++, j--, angle += freq )
00090             window[j] = ( window[i] = ( REAL ) ( 0.5 - 0.5 * cos( angle ) ) );
00091         break;
00092     case WELCH_WINDOW:
00093         for ( i = 0, j = size - 1; i <= midn; i++, j-- )
00094             window[j] = ( window[i] =
00095                           ( REAL ) ( 1.0 -
00096                                      sqr( ( REAL ) ( i - midm1 ) /
00097                                           ( REAL ) midp1 ) ) );
00098         break;
00099     case PARZEN_WINDOW:
00100         for ( i = 0, j = size - 1; i <= midn; i++, j-- )
00101             window[j] = ( window[i] =
00102                           ( REAL ) ( 1.0 -
00103                                      fabs( ( REAL ) ( i - midm1 ) /
00104                                            ( REAL ) midp1 ) ) );
00105         break;
00106     case BARTLETT_WINDOW:
00107         for ( i = 0, j = size - 1, angle = 0.0; i <= midn;
00108               i++, j--, angle += rate )
00109             window[j] = ( window[i] = angle );
00110         break;
00111     case HAMMING_WINDOW:
00112         for ( i = 0, j = size - 1, angle = 0.0; i <= midn;
00113               i++, j--, angle += freq )
00114             window[j] = ( window[i] =
00115                           ( REAL ) ( 0.54 - 0.46 * cos( angle ) ) );
00116         break;
00117     case BLACKMAN2_WINDOW:     /* using Chebyshev polynomial equivalents here */
00118         for ( i = 0, j = size - 1, angle = 0.0; i <= midn;
00119               i++, j--, angle += freq )
00120         {
00121             cx = ( REAL ) cos( angle );
00122             window[j] = ( window[i] =
00123                           ( REAL ) ( .34401 +
00124                                      ( cx *
00125                                        ( -.49755 + ( cx * .15844 ) ) ) ) );
00126         }
00127         break;
00128     case BLACKMAN3_WINDOW:
00129         for ( i = 0, j = size - 1, angle = 0.0; i <= midn;
00130               i++, j--, angle += freq )
00131         {
00132             cx = ( REAL ) cos( angle );
00133             window[j] = ( window[i] =
00134                           ( REAL ) ( .21747 +
00135                                      ( cx *
00136                                        ( -.45325 +
00137                                          ( cx *
00138                                            ( .28256 -
00139                                              ( cx * .04672 ) ) ) ) ) ) );
00140         }
00141         break;
00142     case BLACKMAN4_WINDOW:
00143         for ( i = 0, j = size - 1, angle = 0.0; i <= midn;
00144               i++, j--, angle += freq )
00145         {
00146             cx = ( REAL ) cos( angle );
00147             window[j] = ( window[i] =
00148                           ( REAL ) ( .084037 +
00149                                      ( cx *
00150                                        ( -.29145 +
00151                                          ( cx *
00152                                            ( .375696 +
00153                                              ( cx *
00154                                                ( -.20762 +
00155                                                  ( cx *
00156                                                    .041194 ) ) ) ) ) ) ) ) );
00157         }
00158         break;
00159     case EXPONENTIAL_WINDOW:
00160         for ( i = 0, j = size - 1; i <= midn; i++, j-- )
00161         {
00162             window[j] = ( window[i] = ( REAL ) ( expsum - 1.0 ) );
00163             expsum *= expn;
00164         }
00165         break;
00166     case RIEMANN_WINDOW:
00167         sr1 = two_pi / ( REAL ) size;
00168         for ( i = 0, j = size - 1; i <= midn; i++, j-- )
00169         {
00170             if ( i == midn )
00171                 window[j] = ( window[i] = 1.0 );
00172             else
00173             {
00174                 /* split out because NeXT C compiler can't handle the full expression */
00175                 cx = sr1 * ( midn - i );
00176                 window[i] = ( REAL ) ( sin( cx ) / cx );
00177                 window[j] = window[i];
00178             }
00179         }
00180         break;
00181     case BLACKMANHARRIS_WINDOW:
00182     {
00183         REAL a0 = 0.35875f,
00184             a1 = 0.48829f,
00185             a2 = 0.14128f,
00186             a3 = 0.01168f;
00187 
00188         for ( i = 0; i < size; i++ )
00189         {
00190             window[i] =
00191                 ( REAL ) ( a0 -
00192                            a1 * cos( two_pi * ( REAL ) ( i + 0.5 ) /
00193                                      ( REAL ) ( size - 1 ) ) +
00194                            a2 * cos( 2.0 * two_pi * ( REAL ) ( i + 0.5 ) /
00195                                      ( REAL ) ( size - 1 ) ) -
00196                            a3 * cos( 3.0 * two_pi * ( REAL ) ( i + 0.5 ) /
00197                                      ( REAL ) ( size - 1 ) ) );
00198         }
00199     }
00200         break;
00201     case NUTTALL_WINDOW:
00202     {
00203         REAL a0 = 0.3635819f,
00204             a1 = 0.4891775f,
00205             a2 = 0.1365995f,
00206             a3 = 0.0106411f;
00207 
00208         for ( i = 0; i < size; i++ )
00209         {
00210             window[i] =
00211                 ( REAL ) ( a0 -
00212                            a1 * cos( two_pi * ( REAL ) ( i + 0.5 ) /
00213                                      ( REAL ) ( size - 1 ) ) +
00214                            a2 * cos( 2.0 * two_pi * ( REAL ) ( i + 0.5 ) /
00215                                      ( REAL ) ( size - 1 ) ) -
00216                            a3 * cos( 3.0 * two_pi * ( REAL ) ( i + 0.5 ) /
00217                                      ( REAL ) ( size - 1 ) ) );
00218         }
00219     }
00220         break;
00221     default:
00222         return 0;
00223         break;
00224     }
00225 
00226     return window;
00227 }
Generated on Thu Apr 5 14:11:32 2007 for DttSp by  1.5.1
